overview:
## Overview

A menu system groups root menus together. The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem/main] system has only one root menu while the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem/context] system can have multiple root menus, each built in different [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder] objects like a view controller.

Use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem] in your implementation of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder/buildMenu(with:)] to isolate changes to a specific system.

You can also use a menu system to rebuild or revalidate menus as changes occur in your app. To rebuild a menu, call the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem/setNeedsRebuild()] method. Call [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem/setNeedsRevalidate()] when you need the menu system to revalidate a menu.

For more information, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/adding-menus-and-shortcuts-to-the-menu-bar-and-user-interface].

# UIMenuSystem

**Class**

An object representing a main or contextual menu system.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIMenuSystem
```

## Overview

A menu system groups root menus together. The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem/main] system has only one root menu while the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem/context] system can have multiple root menus, each built in different [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder] objects like a view controller.

Use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem] in your implementation of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder/buildMenu(with:)] to isolate changes to a specific system.

```swift
override func buildMenu(with builder: UIMenuBuilder) {
    super.buildMenu(with: builder)
    
    // Ensure that the builder is modifying the menu bar system.
    guard builder.system == UIMenuSystem.main else { return }

    // ...
}
```

You can also use a menu system to rebuild or revalidate menus as changes occur in your app. To rebuild a menu, call the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem/setNeedsRebuild()] method. Call [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuSystem/setNeedsRevalidate()] when you need the menu system to revalidate a menu.

For more information, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/adding-menus-and-shortcuts-to-the-menu-bar-and-user-interface].

## Getting a menu system

- **main**: The main menu system.
- **context**: The context menu system.

## Rebuilding a menu system

- **setNeedsRebuild()**: Tells the menu system to rebuild all of its menus.

## Revalidating a menu system

- **setNeedsRevalidate()**: Tells the menu system to validate all of its menus.

## Setting group preferences

- **UIMenuSystem.ElementGroupPreference**

## App menus

- **UIMenu**: A container for grouping related menu elements in an app menu or contextual menu.
- **UIMenuBuilder**: An interface for adding and removing menus from a menu system.
- **UIMainMenuSystem**: The main menu system.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Inherited By

- UIContextMenuSystem
- UIMainMenuSystem

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
